noun.description: An uncommon mineral of the tetragonal crystal system which consists of calcium molybdate, CaMoO₄ (usually with molybdenum partly replaced by tungsten), and occurs chiefly as translucent, pyramidal crystals with a yellow fluorescence.

adjective.description: Of, relating to, characteristic of, or advocating Powellism.

origin: 1960s; earliest use found in The Economist. From the name of John Enoch Powell + -ite.
